{"step_by_step_thinking": "Zellweger syndrome is a peroxisomal disorder. Peroxisomes are involved in the breakdown of very long chain fatty acids (VLCFAs). In Zellweger syndrome, this process is disrupted, leading to an accumulation of VLCFAs. Therefore, in a patient with Zellweger syndrome, we would expect to see an accumulation of VLCFAs in the brain.", "answer_choice": "C. Long chain fatty acid"}
